page.title: 10TRANSPORT
page.content: People in our villages need cars to enable them to go to work and often a second car is needed by families for the shopping and the needs of the children. Public transport is poor with only one bus service in Binegar and one in Oakhill. From Binegar one can only reach Wells or Bath and not the nearest town of Shepton Mallet, while the people of Oakhill can only travel to Shepton Mallet and Bath. Neither village has any link with Bristol. The council provide transport for older children to reach their secondary school in the nearest town. However, most of the junior children have to make their own way to school and as their routes are up to 2 miles long, often along busy main roads with no pavements, parents rely heavily on each other for transport or escorting children.
